question: Which one of the following observations is correct for the features of logarithm function to any base <katex>$b>1$</katex>?
choices: The domain of the logarithm function is R, the set of real numbers.
The range of the logarithm function is R, the set of all positive real numbers.
The point (1, 0) is always on the graph of the logarithm function.
The graph of the logarithm function is decreasing as we move from left to right.
explanation: <katex>$\log_b 1 = 0$</katex>, so (1,0) is always on the graph.
